name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. James L. BEEMER, Appellee

judges: Before FLAHERTY, C.J., and ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN and SAYLOR, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. James L. BEEMER, Appellee,

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Based upon our disposition in Commonwealth v. Williams, 557 Pa. 285, 733 A.2d 593 (1999), we affirm the Order of the Lehigh County Court of Common Pleas dated December 8, 1997. Furthermore, we remand the matter to the common pleas court for disposition of any remaining issues.
Jurisdiction is relinquished.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Stephen M. Van Natten, Asst. Dist. Atty., James B. Martin, Dist. Atty., District Attorney’s Office, for Com.
John J. Waldron, Allentown, for James L. Beemer.
casebody.head_matter:
734 A.2d 1289
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. James L. BEEMER, Appellee,
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted Aug. 3, 1999.
Decided Sept. 9, 1999.
Stephen M. Van Natten, Asst. Dist. Atty., James B. Martin, Dist. Atty., District Attorney’s Office, for Com.
John J. Waldron, Allentown, for James L. Beemer.
Before FLAHERTY, C.J., and ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN and SAYLOR, JJ.
